title: Indie 69 March 2009 - Creative Frenzy Edition
description:
Hello again everyone. And thanks for seeding on the last one. I worked a little harder on this one to get more variation, but honestly there was just a LOT of 
new stuff with an americana feel to it that came out. Which is not bad, it just sometimes feels a bit like over-saturation. As you may have noticed, the definition I'm using for  what it means to be INDIE is probably a little 
different than some other's. I'm going for a more true independent direction. 
And I'm doing my very best to avoid  things coming from the major label machines. There will be exceptions. I WANT OTHERS to do these so I can be surprised every month like I used to. By the time this comes out, I will know pretty much all the tracks. I REALLY miss Criznittle's playlists.

Thanks for the great comments, too. You can now contact me with links to tracks,
suggestions and comments at <a class="__cf_email__" href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" data-cfemail="b8d1d6dcd1dd8e81f8d0cdcbd0d5d9d1d496dbd7d5">[email&#160;protected]</a><script cf-hash='f9e31' type="text/javascript">
/* <![CDATA[ */!function(){try{var t="currentScript"in document?document.currentScript:function(){for(var t=document.getElementsByTagName("script"),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute("cf-hash"))return t[e]}();if(t&&t.previousSibling){var e,r,n,i,c=t.previousSibling,a=c.getAttribute("data-cfemail");if(a){for(e="",r=parseInt(a.substr(0,2),16),n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)i=parseInt(a.substr(n,2),16)^r,e+=String.fromCharCode(i);e=document.createTextNode(e),c.parentNode.replaceChild(e,c)}}}catch(u){}}();/* ]]> */</script>   .

The tracks are in no particular order, with the exception of track ONE*, which will
always be the one track that stuck out for me. 

* In this case, it's William Doyle's new album, which is truly stunning and worth
the download. You can find the whole album here at this link. One of the few
artists here that makes his music directly available. Support him for doing so
if you love it as much as I did:


William Doyle - Born In The U.S.B. 

(on TPB)




The rest are mostly randomly sequenced, with a little attention to not stringing 
the same types all together in lumps, for variety. If you have suggestions or recommendations for next month, please leave comments/links at either mininova, 
demonoid or TPB comments. I tag all three once the torrents are up and will watch 
them. Or you can e-mail me at

<a class="__cf_email__" href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" data-cfemail="fd9493999498cbc4bd95888e95909c9491d39e9290">[email&#160;protected]</a><script cf-hash='f9e31' type="text/javascript">
/* <![CDATA[ */!function(){try{var t="currentScript"in document?document.currentScript:function(){for(var t=document.getElementsByTagName("script"),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute("cf-hash"))return t[e]}();if(t&&t.previousSibling){var e,r,n,i,c=t.previousSibling,a=c.getAttribute("data-cfemail");if(a){for(e="",r=parseInt(a.substr(0,2),16),n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)i=parseInt(a.substr(n,2),16)^r,e+=String.fromCharCode(i);e=document.createTextNode(e),c.parentNode.replaceChild(e,c)}}}catch(u){}}();/* ]]> */</script>


Hope you love March. I loved doing it. And as long as we avoid nuclear winter
or zombie infestations, as long as new music is out there and as long as you
keep downloading, I'll keep making them.



... indiesixtynine
